docs.abstract: After two nonprofits delivered 23,000 signatures to Amazon asking it to remove skin-bleaching products with high levels of mercury, the company listened.
docs.snippet: After two nonprofits delivered 23,000 signatures to Amazon asking it to remove skin-bleaching products with high levels of mercury, the company listened.
docs.lead_paragraph: Dark skin can be heavy to walk around in. It is not widely represented in movies or television. Black Americans with darker complexions are more likely to say they experience frequent racism. And dark-skinned women around the world are flooded with advertising telling them that white is beautiful.

headline.main: Fight Against Colorism Takes On Amazon: Beauty ‘Cannot Be One Skin Color’
headline.print_headline: Fighting Colorism, One Illegal Product at a Time

docs.abstract: The Swedish retailer now lets customers know where nearly every garment it sells is made. Is that enough?
docs.snippet: The Swedish retailer now lets customers know where nearly every garment it sells is made. Is that enough?
docs.lead_paragraph: The H&M group sells  an estimated three billion articles of clothing per year. Its revenue makes it among the top three fashion retailers in the world.

headline.print_headline: Do You Know Where Your H&M Sweater Is Made?

byline.original: By Elizabeth Paton and Sapna Maheshwari

docs.abstract: Economists have long criticized tax breaks to corporations; politicians and the public may be starting to share their skepticism.
docs.snippet: Economists have long criticized tax breaks to corporations; politicians and the public may be starting to share their skepticism.
docs.lead_paragraph: In exchange for tens of thousands of tech jobs, cities promised Amazon the moon — and an airport lounge, and naming rights, and a chance to pocket its own employees’ taxes. States offered incentive packages worth $7 billion, $8.5 billion, $9.7 billion, any of which would have set records.

headline.main: In the End, Amazon Didn’t Win Its Own Subsidy Game
headline.print_headline: In the End, Amazon Failed to Win Its Own Subsidy Game in New York

docs.abstract: The manufacturer could announce its plans today for the troubled plane, which has been out of service since two deadly crashes.
docs.snippet: The manufacturer could announce its plans today for the troubled plane, which has been out of service since two deadly crashes.
docs.lead_paragraph: (Want this by email? Sign up here.)

docs.abstract: TV’s streaming wars are a global contest, and this year India became one of the most hotly contested fronts.
docs.snippet: TV’s streaming wars are a global contest, and this year India became one of the most hotly contested fronts.
docs.lead_paragraph: With companies like Netflix and Amazon seeking ever larger international customer bases, one thing that distinguishes the streaming wars from previous TV conflicts is the global scale. And in 2019, India became one of the most hotly contested fronts.

headline.main: In 2019, Netflix and Amazon Set Their Sights on India
headline.print_headline: Netflix and Amazon Set Their Sights on India

docs.abstract: In Campbellsville, Ky., the tech giant’s influences abound. The profits, not so much.
docs.snippet: In Campbellsville, Ky., the tech giant’s influences abound. The profits, not so much.
docs.lead_paragraph: CAMPBELLSVILLE, Ky. — In the late 1990s, the town of Campbellsville in central Kentucky suffered a powerful jolt when its Fruit of the Loom textile plant closed. Thousands of jobs making underwear went to Central America, taking the community’s pride with them.

headline.main: Prime Anchor: An Amazon Warehouse Town Dreams of a Better Life
headline.print_headline: Town Feels Tech Giant’s Influence, but Tastes Little of Its Profits

docs.abstract: For his peak-TV coming-out party, the acting icon chooses a series that rolls together comic books, caper films, New York in the ’70s — and the Holocaust
docs.snippet: For his peak-TV coming-out party, the acting icon chooses a series that rolls together comic books, caper films, New York in the ’70s — and the Holocaust
docs.lead_paragraph: “Hunters,” a new series coming to Amazon Prime Video on Friday, offers various ways in. A lot of people will be excited because Jordan Peele helped bring it about. (He’s an executive producer.) That would have been me in 2015, post “Key and Peele”; not so much now, post “Twilight Zone” and “Us.”

headline.main: Review: Al Pacino and Nazis, in Amazon’s ‘Hunters’

docs.abstract: The actor’s new Amazon series about renegade Nazi hunters is loosely inspired by actual events but has more in common with comic books and ’70s action flicks.
docs.snippet: The actor’s new Amazon series about renegade Nazi hunters is loosely inspired by actual events but has more in common with comic books and ’70s action flicks.
docs.lead_paragraph: When Logan Lerman was offered the lead in “Hunters,” he did what all actors do: He cast about for inspiration.

headline.main: In ‘Hunters,’ Al Pacino Stalks Nazis Into New Territory
headline.print_headline: Al Pacino Stalks Nazis in This Pulpy Thriller

docs.abstract: Pledging that the retailer would be carbon neutral by 2040, Jeff Bezos, the C.E.O., said it was ordering 100,000 electric delivery trucks.
docs.snippet: Pledging that the retailer would be carbon neutral by 2040, Jeff Bezos, the C.E.O., said it was ordering 100,000 electric delivery trucks.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Amazon committed on Thursday to meeting the goals of the Paris climate agreement 10 years ahead of schedule and be carbon neutral by 2040, in the company’s most ambitious push yet to combat climate change.

headline.main: Amazon Accelerates Efforts to Fight Climate Change

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change

byline.original: By David McCabe and Karen Weise

docs.abstract: So far, the Everything Store has dodged some of the scrutiny dogging Google and Facebook.
docs.snippet: So far, the Everything Store has dodged some of the scrutiny dogging Google and Facebook.
docs.lead_paragraph: SEATTLE — The International Brotherhood of Teamsters, with its 1.4 million truck drivers, warehouse workers and other transportation laborers, does not represent any Amazon workers, nor is it organizing them. But the union keeps butting into the e-commerce giant, which ships billions of packages a year.

headline.main: Unions Push F.T.C. to Study if Amazon Warps the Economy
headline.print_headline: Unions Hope To Sic F.T.C. On Amazon

byline.original: By Karen Weise and David McCabe
